add.allocate_ram_guide_mmc: You should allocate `{}-{}` MB{} by going to `Settings > Java` in `{}`.
add.eav_crash_controller: - If you have a controller plugged in, unplug it.
add.eav_crash_disclaimer: Please note that the options listed above are not inherently bad things.
add.eav_crash_drivers: - Driver issues: update / downgrade graphics drivers.
add.eav_crash_hardware: - Hardware issues: don't overclock and run a stress test.
add.eav_crash_mods: - Disable all mods to see if one of them is causing the crash.
add.eav_crash_obs: - Concurrently running programs, such as `OBS` and `Discord`, that use the same graphics card as the game:
add.eav_crash_obs_2: b) Using game capture instead of window capture in `OBS`.
add.eav_crash_obs_3: c) If you're on a laptop, [this page](https://obsproject.com/kb/minecraft-java-edition-troubleshooting) may be helpful.
add.eav_crash_sodium: - `Sodium` may cause this crash. If Minecraft doesn't crash with `Sodium` disabled, using `Sodium Mac` instead (from [this website](https://mods.tildejustin.dev/?version=1.16.1&os=osx) or select `Mac` in [ModCheck](https://github.com/tildejustin/modcheck/releases/latest)) should fix the crash.
add.eav_crash_srigt: - A compatibility issue between `SpeedRunIGT`, `Intel Graphics` and `OpenGL`: enable `Safe Font Mode` in `SpeedRunIGT`'s options.
add.fabric_guide_mcsrlauncher: You can {} Fabric by right clicking your instance and doing `Edit Instance > Version > Change Version` in `MCSR Launcher`.
add.fabric_guide_mmc: You can {} Fabric by doing `Edit Instance > Version > Install Fabric` in `MultiMC`.
add.fabric_guide_prism: You can {} Fabric by doing `Edit > Version > Install Loader > Fabric` in `Prism`.
add.intell_hd2000_info: For more information about this issue and possible solutions, please refer to [**this page**](https://prismlauncher.org/wiki/getting-started/installing-java/#a-note-about-intel-hd-20003000-on-windows-10).
add.java_guide: See [**this guide**](https://gist.github.com/maskersss/5847d594fc6ce4feb66fbd2d3fda281d) or do `/recommend_settings` for a guide on how to fix it.
add.java_guide_javacord: See [**this guide**](https://gist.github.com/maskersss/5847d594fc6ce4feb66fbd2d3fda281d) or DM `/recommend_settings` to me for a guide on how to fix it.
add.java_override_warning: Note that your instance's `Java` settings seem to override global `Java` settings, so you'll need to select `Java` there (or disable the override).
add.java_update_guide.discord: Use :point_right: [**this guide**](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PIjyPMulI3r5aZpfywt5OQR_12qEzX5UTfU8DQHtNp8/edit) :point_left: to update your Java version. It is recommended you install Java **for all users**.
add.java_update_guide.web: Use [**this guide**](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PIjyPMulI3r5aZpfywt5OQR_12qEzX5UTfU8DQHtNp8/edit) to update your Java version. It is recommended you install Java **for all users**.
add.java_update_guide_linux: Use [**this guide**](https://prismlauncher.org/wiki/getting-started/installing-java/#manually-installing-java) to update your Java version.
add.java_update_guide_mcsrlauncher.disco: Use :point_right: [**this guide**](https://gist.github.com/maskersss/ee30ca16d33e7b8bb51e246ff62c83d6/) :point_left: to update your Java version.
add.java_update_guide_mcsrlauncher.web: Use [**this guide**](https://gist.github.com/maskersss/ee30ca16d33e7b8bb51e246ff62c83d6/) to update your Java version.
add.java_update_guide_prism.discord: Use :point_right: [**this guide**](https://gist.github.com/maskersss/0993754fb91686f78f8c000280699fa4/) :point_left: to update your Java version.
add.java_update_guide_prism.web: Use [**this guide**](https://gist.github.com/maskersss/0993754fb91686f78f8c000280699fa4/) to update your Java version.
add.javacord_slash_cmds: Note that you're in a server with slash commands disabled.
add.k4_setup_guide: Check out [**this video**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RSLv7FfQZKY) for a guide on how to set up for Minecraft speedrunning.
add.legacy_fabric_guide: You can {} `Legacy Fabric` instances for `MultiMC` / `Prism` from [**here**](https://github.com/Minecraft-Java-Edition-Speedrunning/legacy-fabric-instance-generator/releases). To import them, go to `Add instance > Import from zip` in your launcher.
add.mac_setup_guide: You can check out [**this guide**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GomIeW5xdBM) for how to set up speedrunning on a Mac.
add.modcheck_v1_warning: The previous versions (v1/v2) of `ModCheck` are no longer supported. Please ensure that your `ModCheck` is up-to-date.
add.oompc_idk: If that didn't help, you can try rebooting your PC, closing all other applications, and allocating less RAM.
add.oompc_paging: Run `systempropertiesperformance.exe` in command prompt, go to the `Advanced` tab, click `Change...` and ensure "Automatically manage paging file size for all drives" is ticked.
add.oompc_paging_nonwindows: Make sure your pagefile settings aren't messed up.
add.outdated_mods_crash_arsg: `AreEssGee` hasn't been updated to work with a new `SpeedrunAPI` version, you can instead find a zip with older mods [**here**](https://discord.com/channels/1056779246728658984/1074385256070791269/1386927513963466823).
add.prism_mmc_migrate: You can check out [**this guide**](https://prismlauncher.org/wiki/getting-started/migrating-multimc/) for how to migrate from `MultiMC` to `Prism`.
add.ranked_mods_disclaimer: If you're still confused, it's possible the latest versions of mods aren't whitelisted. In this case, you should ask for help in https://discord.com/channels/1056779246728658984/1074385256070791269 in [**MCSR Ranked Discord**](https://mcsrranked.com/discord).
add.read_pls: Please actually follow the above guide closely.
add.too_new_java: If you have the latest version of `Fabric Loader`, use a lower `Java` version instead, for example `Java 21`.
add.update_mods: You can get the latest versions of all mods from [**this website**](https://mods.tildejustin.dev/) or by using [**ModCheck**](https://github.com/tildejustin/modcheck/releases/latest).
add.update_mods_prism: To update it in `Prism`, you can do `Edit > Mods > Check for Updates`.
add.update_mods_ranked: You can get the latest versions of all mods from [**this website**](https://gist.github.com/RedLime/bb1d3f49a01ff43f21bc218da964cdd8) or by using [**ModCheck**](https://github.com/tildejustin/modcheck/releases/latest).
add.update_prism_installer: To do that, simply run the installer for the latest version.
add.upload_log_leaked_username.discord: You can press the `Re-Upload Log` button so the bot will re-upload the log with the PC username censored.
add.upload_log_too_large.discord: Please note that your log is too large. Only the first `{}` and last `{}` lines will be uploaded.
error.32_bit_java: You're using 32-bit `Java`, which prevents you from allocating more than ~`2000 MB` to Minecraft.
error.32_bit_java_crash: This crash is caused by using a 32-bit installation of `Java`.
error.arm_java_multimc: `MultiMC` doesn't support `ARM Java`. You should use [**Prism Launcher**](https://prismlauncher.org/) instead.
error.assets_index_fail: Try restarting your PC and then launching the instance again.
error.authlib_injector_crash: This crash is caused by using a launcher that isn't legal for speedrunning.
error.beachfilter_unsupported: `BeachFilter Mod` is no longer supported. You should use [**FSG Mod**](https://modrinth.com/mod/fsg-mod) with the beach filter instead.
error.broken_fabric: You're using a broken version of `Fabric Loader`. You should update it.
error.broken_java: Your `Java` installation seems to be broken.
error.broken_loader: Your modloader doesn't seem to be installed correctly. Try removing and installing it back in `Edit{} > Version`.
error.builtin_lib_crash: Your instance is using your system's {}, which is causing the crash. Disable it either in {}'s global settings in `Settings > Minecraft{}` or in instance settings in `Settings > Workarounds`.
error.builtin_lib_prob_crash: Your instance is using your system's {}, which may be causing the crash. Try disabling it either in {}'s global settings in `Settings > Minecraft{}` or in instance settings in `Settings > Workarounds`.
error.chunk_multidraw: If you're experiencing graphics related issues, such as water being invisible or blocks being inside you, try turning off `Chunk Multidraw` in `Options > Book and Quill > Sodium`.
error.corrupted_file: The file `{}` seems to be corrupted. Try redownloading it.
error.corrupted_instance: Your instance's `mmc-pack.json` appears to be corrupted. Make a new instance and copy over your data between `.minecraft` folders. To prevent this in the future, ensure your system has sufficient disk space and avoid forcefully shutting down your PC.
error.corrupted_mod_config: The config file of the mod `{}` seems to be corrupted. Try deleting it from `.minecraft/config`.
error.corrupted_mods_config: The config file(s) of mod(s) `{}` seem to be corrupted. Try deleting them from `.minecraft/config`.
error.delete_dot_fabric: This crash could be fixed by deleting the `.minecraft/.fabric` folder.
error.delete_launcher_cache: You might need to delete some cached files. To do that, press `Folders > View Launcher Root Folder`, and __**after closing the launcher**__ delete the folder named "meta". If that doesn't help, it's likely a network issue.
error.downgrade_atum: This crash may be fixed by downgrading `Atum` to [**version 1.1.3**](https://modrinth.com/mod/atum/versions).
error.eav_crash: This crash may be caused by one of the following:
error.entity_culling: If your entity counter on F3 is `-1`, turn off `Entity Culling` in `Video Settings`.
error.exclamation_mark_in_path: You have a `!` in your instance path, which breaks Java. You should fix this.
error.exit_wall: To leave to title screen from `SeedQueue`'s wall screen, press `Shift` + `Esc` on the wall, or `Options` > `Stop Resets & Quit` from a world.
error.exitcode: Your game crashed with exitcode `{}`. Here are some possible causes:
error.failed_to_download_log: Failed to download the log (`{}`). Try sending it in a different way (`mclo.gs` link, `pastee.dev` link, attached file).
error.flatpak_sandboxing: This issue is caused by using `Prism` installed from Flatpak, which is sandboxed. Consider installing it [**in a different way**](https://prismlauncher.org/download) instead.
error.forge_java_bug: Old versions of `Forge` crash with `Java 8u321+`. To fix this, update `Forge` to the latest version in `Edit > Version > Forge > Change Version`. Alternatively, you can install and select `Java 8u312 or lower`; see [**here**](https://github.com/adoptium/temurin8-binaries/releases/tag/jdk8u312-b07).
error.forge_missing_dependencies: You seem to be missing dependencies. Check your log to see which mods you're missing.
error.forge_too_new_java: You need to use `Java 8` to use `Forge` on this Minecraft version. Use the below guide to install it, but make sure to install Java **8** instead.
error.gl_framebuffer: This crash is caused by resizing the window to a height that's too large. To fix it, first make sure you're running both `Minecraft` and `Jingle` with `Java 17+`, else see https://discord.com/channels/83066801105145856/405839885509984256/1402922007758114887 for a solution.
error.gl_framebuffer_macos: This crash is caused by resizing the window to a height that's too large. You need to either install the `RetiNO` mod or decrease SlackowWall tall height to `8192`.
error.headless_java: This crash seems to be caused by using a headless `Java` version. Install the full version instead.
error.incompatible_forge_mac: You seem to be using an `Apple M1 Mac` with an incompatible version of `Forge`. Add the following to Java arguments as a workaround: `-Dfml.earlyprogresswindow=false`.
error.incompatible_mod: Mod `{}` is incompatible with mod `{}`. Please remove one of the two.
error.incompatible_srigt: This crash is caused by using an old version of `SpeedRunIGT` that is incompatible with `Fabric Loader 0.14.15+`.
error.incorrect_java_prism: You're using `Java {}`, while you need to use `Java {}`. You can download `Java {}` from [**this page**](https://adoptium.net/temurin/releases/){}. Then make sure to select `Java {}` either globally or in your instance's settings.
error.intel_hd2000: Your issue stems from using `Intel HD2000 integrated graphics`, which only supports up to `OpenGL 3.1`. Unfortunately, there are no dedicated `Windows 10` drivers available for this graphics card. As a result, you will not be easily able to run `Minecraft 1.17+`, as `21w10a and later` require improved graphics capabilities beyond `OpenGL 3.1`. You should still be able to play Minecraft versions `1.16 and earlier`.
error.java_8_network: You're using `Java {}`, which can cause network issues. It is recommended to use `Java 17-22` instead for better performance.
error.java_8_zgc: You are using `ZGC`, which requires `Java 17+`, but you're using `Java {}`.
error.java_comp_check: Enable the `Skip Java compatibility checks` option in `Edit > Settings > Java`.
error.k4_setup_video_outdated: k4yfour's setup video is outdated. For setting up 1.16.1, use [**draconix's guide**](https://youtu.be/RSLv7FfQZKY) instead.
error.leaked_session_id_token.discord: **Your log has your session ID in it. Fully log out and relog back into the launcher right now.**
error.legacy_crash_fix: This seems to be a rare crash that is fixed in the `legacy-crash-fix` mod. You should install it.
error.legacy_fabric_modpack: You likely imported a `Legacy Fabric` modpack. This doesn't work, you'll need to get a `Legacy Fabric` instance from [**here**](https://github.com/Minecraft-Java-Edition-Speedrunning/legacy-fabric-instance-generator/releases) and add the mods to it.
error.legacyjavafixer: This issue is caused by using older `Forge` versions on recent `Java` versions. MinecraftForge provides a mod to fix it; download it [**here**](https://dist.creeper.host/FTB2/maven/net/minecraftforge/lex/legacyjavafixer/1.0/legacyjavafixer-1.0.jar).
error.linux_crash: Mod{} `{}` seem{} to be causing this crash. You should ask for help in the [**MCSR Linux**](https://discord.gg/CVxuagAXMt) server.
error.linux_nvidia_crash: This seems to be a crash caused by NVIDIA drivers version > 525. To fix it, set the `__GL_THREADED_OPTIMIZATIONS` enviroment variable to `0`. In Prism, you can do this in `Settings > Enviroment Variables`.
error.linux_update_lwjgl: This is a Linux crash in old `GLFW` versions. If you're using Prism, to fix it, do `Edit > Version > select LWJGL 3.3.3`.
error.lithium_crash: This seems to be a very rare crash caused by `Lithium` that should be fixed in the latest 1.16.1 version. Alternatively, adding a `mixin.ai.nearby_entity_tracking=false` line into `.minecraft/config/lithium.properties` is believed to fix it.
error.locked_libs: Another process appears to be locking your native library JARs. To solve this, restart your PC.
error.m1_multimc_hack: You seem to be using `M1 MultiMC hack`. It can often cause issues. You should use [**Prism Launcher**](https://prismlauncher.org/) instead.
error.mac_too_new_java: You are using too new of a `Java` version. Please follow the steps on [**this wiki page**](https://prismlauncher.org/wiki/getting-started/installing-java/#older-minecraft-on-macos) to install 8u241.
error.macos_armorstand_crash: This is a crash caused by `Sodium Mac` on `MacOS`. To fix it, add `mixin.features.gui.font=false` to the bottom of `.minecraft/config/sodium-mixins.properties`.
error.maxfps_0_crash: This crash is likely caused by the line `maxFps:0` in your `.minecraft/options.txt` file. If you find it, change `0` to the value you want and save the file.
error.mayas_mod_crash: Mod{} `{}` seem{} to be causing this crash. You should ask for help in the [**Maya's Mods**](https://discord.gg/s9m8gf6pju) server.
error.mclogs_cutoff.discord: Your log seems to be too large, which caused it to get cut off at `25000` lines by `mclo.gs`. You should `Copy` it and paste directly into Discord.
error.mclogs_cutoff.web: Your log seems to be too large, which caused it to get cut off at `25000` lines by `mclo.gs`. You should `Copy` it and paste directly into here.
error.mcsr_corrupted_mods_config: One of the config files in the `.minecraft/config/mcsr/` folder seems to be corrupted. You can try deleting / renaming the folder to see if it'll fix the crash.
error.midnight_bug: Your log seems to be cut off due to `Minecraft` generating a new log at midnight.
error.minecraft_version_mismatch: It looks like you might have `{}` installed for the wrong Minecraft version. Try changing it to the right version in `Edit{} > Version`.
error.missing_dependency: The mod `{}` requires having the mod `{}` installed. Please install it.
error.missing_dependency_2: A mod you're using requires having the mod `{}` installed. Please install it.
error.missing_xrandr: This crash is caused by not having `xrandr` installed on Linux on Minecraft versions using `LWJGL 2`.
error.mod_crash: Mod `{}` seems to be causing this crash.
error.mod_crash_disable: Mod `{}` seems to be causing this crash. Removing it could stop this crash from happening.
error.mods_crash: Mods `{}` seem to be causing this crash.
error.mods_crash_disable: Mods `{}` seem to be causing this crash. Removing one of them could stop this crash from happening.
error.multiple_modloaders: You have multiple modloaders installed (`{}`). Please delete everything but the one you need in `Edit{} > Version`.
error.need_java_17_outdated_mods: You are using an outdated version of {} (`{}`) that required `Java 17+`{}. The latest version of {} is compatible with `Java 8`.
error.need_new_java_mc: You are playing on a Minecraft version that requires using `Java {}+`{}.
error.need_to_extract_from_zip: You didn't extract `{}` when downloading it, which can cause it to be deleted by your operating system. Close the launcher and extract it.
error.new_java_old_fabric_crash: This crash seems to be caused by using an old version of `{} loader` with a new version of `Java`. Update your `{} loader`.
error.newline_in_java_args: You have a newline after `{}` in your Java arguments, which shouldn't exist. You need to remove it.
error.no_fabric: You don't have `Fabric` installed, while all MCSR mods require it.
error.no_loader: You are using mods, but you haven't installed a mod loader.
error.no_voyager_crash: This is a rare crash that can be prevented by using [**Voyager**](https://github.com/modmuss50/Voyager/releases/latest). You should install it.
error.not_a_mod: You put `{}` in the `mods` folder, but it's not a mod, and it will make Minecraft crash while in the `mods` folder. You should move it.
error.old_fabric_crash: This crash seems to be caused by using an outdated version of `Fabric Loader`. You should update it.
error.old_mod_crash: This crash seems to be caused by using an outdated version of `{}`. You need to update it, download the latest version [**here**]({}).
error.old_mod_version: You're using an old `{}` mod version. You should update it, you can download the latest version [**here**]({}).
error.old_sodium_crash: This crash is caused by using an old version of `Sodium`.
error.old_wp_with_stateoutput: This crash is caused by using `State Output` with an old `WorldPreview` version. You should update `WorldPreview`.
error.online_launch_required: Either launch your instance **not** in `offline mode` or do `Edit{} > Version > Download All` so that your launcher can download assets. If Minecraft is getting launched offline by default, try removing and add back your Microsoft account.
error.openal_crash: This seems to be a crash caused by `OpenAL`. See [**here**](https://www.reddit.com/r/linux_gaming/comments/18qjnwk/minecraft_crashing_from_openal/) for more details.
error.out_of_disk_space: It looks like you ran out of disk space. If that's the case, you should free up some space on it.
error.out_of_memory_pc: It looks like you ran out of memory on your PC. Here are some possible solutions:
error.outdated_mods_crash: This crash is caused by using outdated versions of mods. Make sure to update all of them.
error.outdated_nvidia_flatpak_driver: Update drivers for flatpak by running `flatpak update`. If the crash persists, try [not using flatpak](https://prismlauncher.org/download).
error.pasteee_down:
`paste.ee` seems to be down. Instead, please try the following:
1. **Copy** your log using the `Copy` button.
2. Upload it to <https://mclo.gs/>, then provide the link.
3. Alternatively, paste the log directly into Discord as a message, then:
   - Right-click the message.
   - Select `Apps`.
   - Choose `Recommend Settings`.
error.ranked_fabric_0_15_x: You seem to be using a version of `MCSR Ranked` that is incompatible with `Fabric Loader 0.15+`. Update `MCSR Ranked`.
error.ranked_mod_crash: Mod{} `{}` seem{} to be causing this crash. You should ask for help in the [**MCSR Ranked**](https://discord.com/invite/nnjUSyDErj) server.
error.ranked_rong_files: You're using {} to be fine, but the files don't match. Try redownloading/updating {}.
error.ranked_rong_mods: You're using {}n't whitelisted for `MCSR Ranked`. Remove {} from your `mods` folder.
error.ranked_rong_versions: You're using {} outdated and therefore not allowed for `MCSR Ranked`. You should update {}.
error.really_old_fabric: You're using a really old version of `Fabric Loader`. You should update it.
error.recipe_book_crash: This seems to be a rare recipe book crash. It should happen really rarely; there aren't any known solutions to it.
error.requires_fabric_api: You're using a mod that requires `Fabric API`. It is a mod that is separate to `Fabric Loader`. You can download it [**here**](https://modrinth.com/mod/fabric-api).
error.requires_fabric_api_mcsr: You're using a mod that requires `Fabric API`. It is an illegal for speedrun.com mod that is separate to `Fabric Loader`. You can download it [**here**](https://modrinth.com/mod/fabric-api).
error.requires_mod: A mod you're using is requiring a mod `{}`, but it is not present. Download it and add it to your mods folder.
error.rong_modloader: You seem to be using `{}` mods, but you have `{}` installed.
error.run_jingle_as_admin: You are likely running `Minecraft`, but not `Jingle` as administrator. Either do not run `Minecraft` as administrator, or run `Jingle` as administrator by using [**Jingle Launcher**](https://github.com/DuncanRuns/Jingle?tab=readme-ov-file#jingle-launcher).
error.send_full_log: If you got a crash, please send the full log from `Edit{} > Minecraft Log`.
error.settings_reset:
If your settings reset whenever you create a world, you are probably using StandardSettings.
If you want to change which settings reset and what do they reset to, go to `Options > Book and Quill > StandardSettings` and configure them.
If you don't want your settings to reset, set `Use StandardSettings` there to `OFF`.
error.silent_mode: Your game is running in Silent Mode. To fix this, make sure you don't have any weird characters in the instance path (try moving the launcher folder to `C:/`). You can also try changing your LWJGL version in `Edit{} > Version`.
error.snowman_crash: This could be a rare issue often referred to as a snowman crash. It should happen really rarely; there aren't any known solutions to it.
error.sodium_config_crash_old: Your config file for `Sodium` seems to be corrupted. Resolve the issue by deleting `sodium-options.json` from the `.minecraft/config/` directory.
error.sodium_rtss: RivaTuner Statistics Server (RTSS) is not compatible with Sodium. See [**this page**](https://github.com/CaffeineMC/sodium-fabric/wiki/Known-Issues#rtss-incompatible) for more details.
error.sodiummac_crash: This looks like a crash caused by a bug in one of the old mods, which only has a 50% chance of happening. You should update all mods.
error.sq_empty_sound_file: This crash is caused by using a SeedQueue resourcepack with empty sound files. You should either use short silent ones instead, or add [this resourcepack](https://discord.com/channels/1262887973154848828/1263997861620617407/1337527657662775327) above yours.
error.sq_empty_sound_file_invite: This crash is caused by using a SeedQueue resourcepack with empty sound files. You should either use short silent ones instead, or add [this resourcepack](https://discord.com/channels/1262887973154848828/1263997861620617407/1337527657662775327) above yours (link from [SeedQueue server](https://discord.gg/9P6PJkHCdU)).
error.stack_overflow_crash: This seems to be a crash caused by doing too many resets in a row without letting it finish loading a preview. It's fixed in the latest `Atum` version.
error.starlight_crash: This seems to be a rare crash caused by `Starlight` that was fixed in a newer update.
error.tl_malware: You are using `TLauncher`, which is [**malware**](https://www.reddit.com/r/PiratedGames/comments/xo5rf2/about_tlauncher_spywaremalware_sorry_for_made/). You should at least uninstall it.
error.too_little_ram_crash: You have too little RAM allocated, which caused this crash.
error.too_much_ram: You have way too much RAM allocated, which is unnecesssary and [can cause lag spikes](https://vazkii.notion.site/A-semi-technical-explanation-of-why-you-shouldn-t-allocate-too-much-RAM-to-Minecraft-78e7bd41ba6646de8d1c55c033674bce).
error.try_admin_launch: You need to open your launcher with administrator privileges.
error.try_changing_lwjgl_version: Try changing your `LWJGL` version in `Edit{} > Version`.
error.unknown_corrupted_mod_config: The config file of some mod seems to be corrupted. Try renaming / moving out the `.minecraft/config` folder to see if it'll fix the crash.
error.unsupported_intel_gpu: You seem to be using an `Intel` GPU that is not supported on `Windows 10`. You will need to install an older version of `Java`, see [**here**](https://prismlauncher.org/wiki/getting-started/installing-java/#a-note-about-intel-hd-20003000-on-windows-10) for help.
error.update_mmc: This crash is likely caused by using an old `MultiMC` version. Try updating it.
error.use_sodium_not_optifine: You're using `Optifine`. For newer versions, `{}` is way better, so it's recommended to use it instead.
error.use_sodium_not_optifine_mcsr: You're using `Optifine`. It's not allowed for speedrunning on 1.15+, and `Sodium` is recommended to use over `Optifine`.
error.using_modpack_as_mod: You seem to be trying to use a modpack. It is not a mod, and you don't put it in the `mods` folder. Instead, drag it into `{}`'s main screen or do `Add Instance > Import`.
error.using_other_loader_mcsr: You seem to be using MCSR mods, but you have `{}` installed, which is not allowed for speedrunning and is likely to cause issues.
error.using_ssrng: You're using `ServerSideRNG`, which is now illegal and can cause issues. The server for it is down, so the mod is useless regardless and you should delete it.
error.wp_3_plus_crash: This seems to be a rare crash caused by `WorldPreview 3.0.0 - 4.0.1`. It should be fixed in `WorldPreview 4.0.2+`.
error.wrong_java_arg: You have `{}` in your Java arguments, which is not a valid argument. Either fix it or remove it.
error.wrong_sens: Your mouseSensitivity value (`{}`) in `{}` is incorrect for boateye.
error.zgc_graalvm_crash: Old `GraalVM` versions did not support `ZGC`. You should use a newer `GraalVM` version.
info.ask_in_support_channel: If this response did not help you, you should ask in https://discord.com/channels/{}/{}.
info.leaked_username: Your log has your PC username in it. You might want to delete it.
info.send_full_log: Please send the full {} log from `Edit{} > Minecraft Log`.
info.send_watchdog_report: Please send `{}` as it would have more info about this crash.
info.upload_log_attachment.discord: You sent your log as a file. Please press the `Re-Upload Log` button so the log will be re-uploaded to mclo.gs so people can see it without having to download it.
note.amount_illegal_mods: You are using `{}` illegal for speedrunning mod{}!
note.dont_hdd: Your launcher folder is located on the `{}:/` drive, which is often an HDD. If so, consider moving it to `C:/` for better performance.
note.dont_use_java_23_plus: You're using `Java 23+`, which has been found to reduce performance. You should use `Java 17-22` instead.
note.duplicate_mods: You have several versions of `{}` installed. You should delete the older ones.
note.fandom_wiki: The Minecraft Wiki [**has recently moved**](https://minecraft.wiki/w/Minecraft_Wiki:Moving_from_Fandom) from `Fandom` to `minecraft.wiki`. Please use this link instead: **https://minecraft.wiki/w/{}**.
note.illegal_launcher: You're using a launcher that is not legal for [speedrun.com](https://www.speedrun.com/mc).
note.mac_use_arm_java: If you use an `M`-series chip, it is recommended to use `ARM Java` instead of `amd64 Java` for better performance since it will run natively on `ARM` chips.
note.mac_use_prism: If you use an `M`-series chip, it is recommended to use [**Prism Launcher**](https://prismlauncher.org/) with `ARM Java` instead of `MultiMC` for better performance since `Prism` has native `ARM` support.
note.motiono: You're using `MotiNO`, which is illegal for speedrun.com, and `ExtraOptions` is a whitelisted version of it.
note.not_using_java_17: You're using `Java {}`. It is recommended to use `Java 17-22` instead for better performance.
note.old_fabric: You're using a somewhat old version of `Fabric Loader`, you might want to update it.
note.old_prism_version: You're using an outdated `Prism Launcher` version. You should update it, you can download the latest version [**here**](https://prismlauncher.org/).
note.onedrive: Your launcher folder is located in `OneDrive`. `OneDrive` can mess with your game files to save space, and this can lead to crashes. You should move it to a different folder.
note.out_of_disk_space: Make sure you didn't run out of disk space.
note.outdated_mods_linked: You are using `{}` outdated mod{}. Download the latest legal version{} here: {}.
note.program_files: Your game files are in `Program Files`. It is generally not recommended, and could cause some issues. Consider moving it to a different location.
note.semi_old_mmc_version: You're using an outdated `MultiMC` version. To update, simply press the `Update` button in `MultiMC`.
note.semi_old_prism_version: You're using an outdated `Prism Launcher` version. To update, simply press the `Update` button in `Prism`.
note.sq_debug_menu_illegal: You have `Show Debug Menu` enabled in `SeedQueue` settings, which is illegal for speedrun.com.
note.starlight_better: You're using `Phosphor`. `Starlight` is much better than `Phosphor`, you should use it instead.
note.too_little_ram: You may have too little RAM allocated.
note.too_little_ram_crash: This crash may be caused by not having enough RAM allocated.
note.too_much_ram: You likely have too much RAM allocated, which [can cause lag spikes](https://vazkii.notion.site/A-semi-technical-explanation-of-why-you-shouldn-t-allocate-too-much-RAM-to-Minecraft-78e7bd41ba6646de8d1c55c033674bce).
note.use_zgc: It's recommended to use `ZGC` for SeedQueue, but you're not using it.
note.use_zgenerational_is_bad: You're using `ZGenerational`, which has been found to reduce performance.
top_info.uploaded_log: The log has been uploaded to {}.
top_info.uploaded_log_2: The log has been uploaded to {}. (Note that `mclo.gs` censors sensitive information)
warning.dont_use_flatpak: You are using `Prism` installed from Flatpak, which can cause issues due to Flatpak sandboxing and Flatpak drivers. Consider installing it [**in a different way**](https://prismlauncher.org/download) instead.
warning.dont_use_java_arg: You are using the `{}` Java arg{}, which is no longer needed. You should remove it in `Settings > Java`.
warning.mac_use_arm_java: Since you use an `M`-series chip, it is recommended to use `ARM Java` instead of `amd64 Java` for better performance since it will run natively on `ARM` chips.
warning.mac_use_prism: Since you use an `M`-series chip, it is recommended to use [**Prism Launcher**](https://prismlauncher.org/) with `ARM Java` instead of `MultiMC` for better performance since `Prism` has native `ARM` support.
warning.medal: You seem to be using a recording app like `Medal`, which can cause issues. Make sure this isn't the cause of the crash.
warning.missing_and_outdated_mods: You are missing `{}` mod{} (`{}`) and are using `{}` outdated mod{} (`{}`)!
warning.missing_mods: You seem to be missing `{}` recommended mods (`{}`).
warning.missing_mods_linked: You seem to be missing `{}` recommended mod{}. You can download {} here: {}.
warning.no_mappings: Your instance seems to be missing mappings. You might want to check the `Edit{} > Version` tab.
warning.not_using_mac_sodium: You seem to be using a version of `Sodium` that has a memory leak on `MacOS`. Delete the one you have and download `Sodium Mac` from [**this website**](https://mods.tildejustin.dev/?version=1.16.1&os=osx) or by using [**ModCheck**](https://github.com/tildejustin/modcheck/releases/latest) **after selecting Mac** instead.
warning.relatively_old_fabric: You're using an old version of `Fabric Loader`. You should update it.
warning.too_little_ram: You have too little RAM allocated, which can cause crashes and lag spikes.
warning.too_much_ram: You have too much RAM allocated, which [can cause lag spikes](https://vazkii.notion.site/A-semi-technical-explanation-of-why-you-shouldn-t-allocate-too-much-RAM-to-Minecraft-78e7bd41ba6646de8d1c55c033674bce).
